About me

  • Nationality: Australian
  • Residence: Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA
  • Languages: German, Python, Fortran, SQL, Matlab, C, HTML/CSS
  • Education: B.Sc. (Hons), Ph.D (Astrophysics), University of Queensland

I am an astrophysicist and data enthusiast currently working as a postdoctoral research fellow at the Kavli Institute for Astrophysics & Space Research at MIT in Cambridge, Massachusetts. I'm currently leading the Caterpillar Project with the objective of better understanding the formation of the Milky Way and its satellite companions. This is being carried out within the Kavli Institute at MIT and the Center for Astrophysics at Harvard University.

On any given day, I can be found investigating these core research topics:

  • formation of the satellite population of the Milky Way
  • origin of globular clusters and dwarf galaxies
  • globular cluster connection to reionization
  • dark matter halos and structure formation
  • assembly of the old stellar halo

I am also interested in a wide variety of other fields including using large semantic datasets as a window into human nature, linguistics and anthropology.
